sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The life and death of Dr Martin Luther the passages whereof haue bin taken out of his owne and other godly and most learned, mens writings, who liued in his time. Martinus Lutherus. English Adam, Melchior, d. 1622. Hayne, Thomas, 1582-1645. Quarles, Francis, 1592-1644. Holtman, The., engraver.
[20], 142, [2] p. : port.
Printed by: I:L: for Iohn Stafford, and are to be sould at his shop in Chancery lane, ouer against the Rolles, London : 1641.
A translation of: Adam, Melchior. Martinus Lutherus. Translator's dedication signed: Thomas Hayne. The portrait of Luther is signed: The: Holtman fe. The title page is engraved. "To the pretious memory of Dr. Mart. Luther", a sonnet, is signed: Francis Quarles. With a final errata leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The life and death of Dr Martin Luther the passages whereof haue bin taken out of his owne and other godly and most learned, mens writings, who liued in his time. Martinus Lutherus. English Adam, Melchior, d. 1622. Hayne, Thomas, 1582-1645. Quarles, Francis, 1592-1644. Holtman, The., engraver.
[20], 142, [2] p. : port.
Printed by: I:L: for Iohn Stafford, and are to be sould at his shop in Chancery lane, ouer against the Rolles, London : 1641.
A translation of: Adam, Melchior. Martinus Lutherus. Translator's dedication signed: Thomas Hayne. The portrait of Luther is signed: The: Holtman fe. The title page is engraved. "To the pretious memory of Dr. Mart. Luther", a sonnet, is signed: Francis Quarles. With a final errata leaf. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Iohn Stafford
: I:L:
his shop in Chancery lane, ouer against the Rolles
